title: Mount Schicht
text:
Mount Schicht () is a prominent <a href="mountain">mountain</a> with several summits, rising 4 nautical miles (7 km) west-southwest of <a href="Ritscher%20Peak">Ritscher Peak</a> in the <a href="Gruber%20Mountains">Gruber Mountains</a> of <a href="Queen%20Maud%20Land">Queen Maud Land</a>. The feature was discovered by the <a href="New%20Swabia">German Antarctic Expedition</a> under Ritscher, 1938–39, and named Schichtberge (stratum mountains) because of its appearance.
Ufsebotnen Cirque sits 1 mile (1.6 km) north of the summit. It was discovered and plotted from air photos by <a href="Third%20German%20Antarctic%20Expedition">German Antarctic Expedition</a>, 1938–39. Replotted from air photos and surveys by <a href="Sixth%20Norwegian%20Antarctic%20Expedition">Norwegian Antarctic Expedition</a>, 1956–60, and named Ufsebotnen (the bluff <a href="cirque">cirque</a>).
